comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: TechW87 on April 01, 2023, 06:48:07 AMIm unable to find an option to edit the name for wallet in Bitcoin core.Changing file names is something your OS handles. Exit Bitcoin Core, change the wallet name, and load the wallet again.See Bitcoin Wiki for the wallet's location.

comments.author: o_e_l_e_o
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on April 01, 2023, 07:47:17 AMThe old path must still be in your settings somewhere.In the parent folder (one up) from your wallets directory, there will be a file called "settings.json". Open it with any simple text editor. You will find something which looks like this:Code:{    "wallet": [        "WalletName1",        "WalletName2",        "WalletName3"    ]}Change the name of the wallet you renamed to the new name.

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: TechW87 on April 01, 2023, 06:48:07 AMIm unable to find an option to edit the name for wallet in Bitcoin core. The proper way to do this is to unload the wallet first in "File->Close wallet" menu while the target wallet is selected or unloadwallet command.You can now proceed to rename the wallet in the 'wallets' folder, then load it again in Bitcoin Core.If you have pruned your blockchain, doing this may trigger another full IBD as indicated in the pop-up message.
